results.title: The Seven Faces of Dr Lao
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, George Pal Productions and George Pal
results.brief_description: Tony Randall plays seven fantastic and magical characters in this imaginative film based on the novel, “The circus of Dr. Lao”, by Charles G. Finney. A mysterious Chinese gentleman, Dr Lao, rides into the western desert town of Abalone. There he sets up a circus in which the townspeople are confronted by physical manifestations of their own fears and desires. With the arrival of Dr Lao the people of Abalone are to change forever. Randall is excellent in all his roles. The film also stars Barbara Eden.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, George Pal Productions and George Pal

results.title: The Serve with Billie Jean King
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On Tennis”.
Billie Jean King, Vic Braden and Erik Van Dellen start with the simple ‘flat’ serve, then move on to demonstrate the ‘slice’ and the ‘twist’, with detailed coverage of such basics as stance and grip, step and weight transfer, co-ordinating the toss with the swing, and proper follow-through.

results.title: The Servant
results.creator_credit: Springbok Films, Joseph Losey and Norman Priggen
results.brief_description: A socio-psychological drama in which a servant, Barratt, is hired by an upper-class, self-centred young man, who has moved into a new house at Chelsea where he plans to live with his fiancee after their marriage. Gradually the relationship of servant and master changes as the latter finds himself slowly falling under Barratt’s control Harold Pinter’s superb study of brooding hatred and hypocrisy within the ever-shifting borders of the class struggle is based on the novel ‘The Servant’ by Robin Maugham. Music by John Dankworth. Cast: Dirk Bogarde, Sarah Miles, Wendy Craig, James Fox.

results.title: The Serpent's Egg
results.creator_credit: Dino De Laurentiis, Rialto Film and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: Berlin is at boiling point! Money is worthless and fear rules! Through the chaotic madness two people battle to keep their sanity… but what they uncover is far more dangerous than degradation and starvation…the human guinea pigs who risk insanity and death for a square meal. Starring Liv Ullman, David Carradine and James Whitmore.

results.title: The Sentimental bloke
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and F.W. Thring
results.brief_description: Based on the poem by Bill and Doreen’s courtship, marriage and move to the country, this version of C.J.Dennis’ verse narrative adds subplot in which Bill saves Doreen’s Uncle Jim from an attempted swindle. Stars Cecil Scott Ray Fisher, Tal Ordell and Athol Tier.
results.description: Based on the poem by Bill and Doreen’s courtship, marriage and move to the country, this version of C.J.Dennis’ verse narrative adds subplot in which Bill saves Doreen’s Uncle Jim from an attempted swindle. Stars Cecil Scott Ray Fisher, Tal Ordell and Athol Tier.

results.title: The Sentimental bloke
results.creator_credit: Southern Cross Film Co and Raymond Longford
results.brief_description: Classic adaptation of C.J. Dennis’ verse narrative of life in inner Sydney in the 1910s, rich in incident but centring on the romance and marriage of the Bloke and Doreen. Filmed on location in Sydney’s Woolloomooloo and the Hornsby Valley (the orchard scene), it was ahead of its time in the naturalness of the performances from a carefully chosen cast. Starring Arthur Tauchert, Lottie Lyell and Gilbert Emery.

results.title: The Sentence of the court
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
This docudrama looks at what the subsequent history might have been of the boys in the gang that attacked the conductor in the film the “Last Bus” (Title code 006006). Examines the factors which might have caused the boys behaviour, their likely punishment and its effect on them. Companion film to “Last Bus”.

results.title: The Sensory world (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Tom Lazarus, Philip Mendlow, Joel Gold and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”
Examines and demonstrates the empirical mechanics of human perception or misperception of our environments and the functioning - both normal and impaired - of the human senses. Uses animation to demonstrate various phenomena of the brain and illustrates its functions. Includes explanation of experiments with optic fibres and with electrical stimulation of the human brain and the memory.
Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: The Senses of man
results.creator_credit: Gateway Educational Films and Indiana University. Audio Visual Center
results.brief_description: Shows the importance of sense receptors of temperature, pressure, touch and pain. Discusses health considerations pertaining to the senses. A film from the Human Physiology series.
